Package mz

Interface InsertionInterface<T extends Comparable>

Type Parameters:
T - setting of a type based on which the elements can be sorted.
All Superinterfaces:
Sort<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
Intro<T>, IntroDPQ<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Insertion, IntroAnother, IntroBatcherOddEvenMerge, IntroBubble, IntroCocktail, IntroComb, IntroDoubleSelection, IntroDPQAnother, IntroDPQBatcherOddEvenMerge, IntroDPQBubble, IntroDPQCocktail, IntroDPQComb, IntroDPQDoubleSelection, IntroDPQDualPivotQuick, IntroDPQGnome, IntroDPQHeap, IntroDPQInsertion, IntroDPQMerge, IntroDPQMerge3, IntroDPQMergeInPlace, IntroDPQMergeInsertion, IntroDPQOddEven, IntroDPQOddEvenMerge, IntroDPQQuick, IntroDPQQuick3, IntroDPQSelection, IntroDPQShell, IntroDPQSmoothHeap, IntroDPQStableQuick, IntroDPQTernaryHeap, IntroDPQTim, IntroDPQWeakHeap, IntroDPQWeaveMerge, IntroDPQWiki, IntroDualPivotQuick, IntroGnome, IntroHeap, IntroInsertion, IntroMerge, IntroMerge3, IntroMergeInPlace, IntroMergeInsertion, IntroOddEven, IntroOddEvenMerge, IntroQuick, IntroQuick3, IntroSelection, IntroShell, IntroSmoothHeap, IntroStableQuick, IntroTernaryHeap, IntroTim, IntroWeakHeap, IntroWeaveMerge, IntroWiki, MergeInsertion, Shell, Tim, Wiki
public interface InsertionInterface<T extends Comparable> extends Sort<T>
InsertionInterface, containing the methods of Insertion Sort to implement other classes.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Magyar Zolt√°n

    Methods inherited from interface mz.Sort

    sortArray, sortArrayDec, sortArrayInc, sortArrayRev

  • Method Details

    • insertionInc

      default void insertionInc(T[] array)
      insertionInc that performs the Insertion Sort algorithm on a portion of an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in ascending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and an integer index specifying the starting index of the portion to be sorted.
      • The @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") annotation is used to suppress compiler warnings related to type safety when using the compareTo method.
      • The method uses a for loop that starts from the given index and iterates up to the end of the array.
      • Inside the loop, the element at index i is selected and stored in the select variable.
      • An integer variable j is initialized with the value of i.
      • A while loop is used to shift elements to the right and find the correct position for the select element within the portion of the array.
      • The condition (j >= index) ensures that the while loop executes as long as the index is within the specified portion of the array.
      • The condition array[(j - index)].compareTo(select) > 0 compares the element at index (j - index) with the select element. If the element at index (j - index) is greater than the select element, it needs to be shifted to the right.
      • Inside the while loop, the element at index j is replaced with the element at index (j - index), effectively shifting the element to the right.
      • The index j is decremented by index to continue comparing and shifting elements until the correct position for the select element is found.
      • Once the correct position is determined, the select element is placed at index j.
      insertionInc method implements the Insertion Sort algorithm on a portion of the given array of Comparable objects. It iterates over the elements starting from the specified index, compares and shifts elements to the right, and places the selected element at its correct position within the portion of the array. The sorting is done in ascending order.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.

    • insertionDec

      default void insertionDec(T[] array)
      insertionDec that performs the Insertion Sort algorithm on a portion of an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in descending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and an integer index specifying the starting index of the portion to be sorted.
      • The @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") annotation is used to suppress compiler warnings related to type safety when using the compareTo method.
      • The method uses a for loop that starts from the given index and iterates up to the end of the array.
      • Inside the loop, the element at index i is selected and stored in the select variable.
      • An integer variable j is initialized with the value of i.
      • A while loop is used to shift elements to the right and find the correct position for the select element within the portion of the array.
      • The condition (j >= index) ensures that the while loop executes as long as the index is within the specified portion of the array.
      • The condition array[(j - index)].compareTo(select) < 0 compares the element at index (j - index) with the select element. If the element at index (j - index) is smaller than the select element, it needs to be shifted to the right.
      • Inside the while loop, the element at index j is replaced with the element at index (j - index), effectively shifting the element to the right.
      • The index j is decremented by index to continue comparing and shifting elements until the correct position for the select element is found.
      • Once the correct position is determined, the select element is placed at index j.
      insertionDec method implements the Insertion Sort algorithm on a portion of the given array of Comparable objects. It iterates over the elements starting from the specified index, compares and shifts elements to the right, and places the selected element at its correct position within the portion of the array. The sorting is done in descending order.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.

The sorting is done in ascending order.

      array - to be arranged.
      from - the element from which to start the analysis.
      to - the element to be analyzed.

    • insertionDec

      default void insertionDec(T[] array, int from, int to)
      insertionDec that performs the Insertion Sort algorithm on a portion of an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in descending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and an integer index specifying the starting index of the portion to be sorted.

      • The method uses a for loop that starts from the given index and iterates up to the end of the array.

      • An integer variable j is initialized with the value of i.

      • The condition (j >= index) ensures that the while loop executes as long as the index is within the specified portion of the array.
      • The condition array[(j - index)].compareTo(select) < 0 compares the element at index (j - index) with the select element. If the element at index (j - index) is smaller than the select element, it needs to be shifted to the right.
      • Inside the while loop, the element at index j is replaced with the element at index (j - index), effectively shifting the element to the right.
      • The index j is decremented by index to continue comparing and shifting elements until the correct position for the select element is found.
      • Once the correct position is determined, the select element is placed at index j.
